intro: Impatiens ivohibensis, commonly known as the Ivohibena Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically come in shades of pink and white. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its unique floral structure and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
